page.title: 03Kings Cross
page.content: The thing's I found out at Kings Cross is that they do not know who built Kings Cross but the station is 102 years old. They don't know where the bricks came from. The electritians look after the clock because the clock is electric and it has Roman numerals on it. The British railways board owns the station H.S.T. means high speed train one of the trains was the Flying Scotsman. They used to have eight lines but know they have ten. Lots of train guards look after the station. The station doesn't close. Do you know the Great Northan Railway Company payed for kings cross to be built and do you know the furthest the trains can go is 487 miles Kings Cross to Inverness and the last to come in is at 11.45pm.
